layer.name: Causality
layer.definition: Actions have consequences; you reap what you sow.

questions.text: Most of my health outcomes are influenced by my accumulated choices ...

answers.4: mostly — my choices significantly shape my health
answers.5: largely — I am the primary author of my health outcomes
answers.2: possibly — but so much is beyond my control
answers.3: partially — choices matter, but so do factors I can't influence
answers.1: not really — health is mostly genetics and luck

questions.text: Chronic health issues often have lifestyle factors that contributed ...

answers.4: usually — lifestyle choices contribute to most chronic conditions
answers.5: almost always — even with genetic factors, lifestyle accelerates or prevents
answers.2: possibly — but the connection is unclear
answers.3: sometimes — some issues have lifestyle roots, others don't
answers.1: not necessarily — chronic issues just happen

questions.text: Preventive care vs. reactive crisis management produces different outcomes ...

answers.4: clearly — maintenance produces different long-term results
answers.5: dramatically — the approach shapes everything about health trajectory
answers.2: possibly — but crises are unpredictable anyway
answers.3: somewhat — prevention helps, but some crises can't be avoided
answers.1: not significantly — you deal with what comes regardless

questions.text: My body, soul, and spirit are connected — neglect in one affects the others ...

answers.4: clearly — neglect in one area shows up in others
answers.5: deeply — I am one integrated being; everything connects
answers.2: possibly — but I don't see clear connections
answers.3: somewhat — some spillover happens, but they're mostly independent

questions.text: People who are healthy later in life usually made different choices than those who aren't ...

answers.4: usually — long-term health reflects long-term patterns
answers.5: consistently — decades of choices compound into decades of outcomes
answers.3: partly — choices matter, but so does fortune
answers.1: not necessarily — health in old age is mostly luck

remediation.advice: Look at older people you know. The healthy ones made different choices than the unhealthy ones. You are currently planting seeds for your future health. What harvest are your current choices producing in 20 years?
